TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IUpdatable

Docs.summary: An interface used to insert or update a resource by the HTTP POST method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable> interface is resource independent. The methods that return objects representing resources can return anything.
The returned object is an opaque object that represents the resource. To use the reference to read or update a value, the same opaque object is passed back to <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable>.
Implementation of <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable> must track the mapping between this opaque object to the object it represents. When the resource is serialized and a common language runtime (CLR) instance of the correct type is needed, the ResolveResource method on <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable> is called with the opaque object.
To serialize the object, call the <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable.ResolveResource%2A> method on <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable>.

Docs.param: Target object that defines the property.
The name of the collection property to which the resource should be added.
The opaque object representing the resource to be added.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified value to the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public object CreateResource (string containerName, string fullTypeName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object CreateResource(string containerName, string fullTypeName) cil managed
Public Function CreateResource (containerName As String, fullTypeName As String) As Object
public: System::Object ^ CreateResource(System::String ^ containerName, System::String ^ fullTypeName);
abstract member CreateResource : string * string -> obj

Docs.param: The name of the entity set to which the resource belongs.
The full namespace-qualified type name of the resource.
Docs.summary: Creates the resource of the specified type and that belongs to the specified container.
Docs.returns: The object representing a resource of specified type and belonging to the specified container.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable.CreateResource%2A> is called to insert a new resource by the HTTP POST method. The first parameter points to the container that the resource belongs to and the second parameter is the namespace-qualified name of the resource type that needs to be created.
The second parameter is most useful when using inheritance. The return type need not be the actual CLR instance of the resource. It can be anything, for example, a cookie, that the implementation requires.

Docs.param: The resource to be deleted.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `targetResource` is the opaque object returned by <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable.GetResource%2A> or <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable.CreateResource%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets the resource of the specified type identified by a query and type name.
Docs.returns: An opaque object representing a resource of the specified type, referenced by the specified query.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called for scalar properties or complex properties. For a scalar property, the returned object should be the actual value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Removes the specified resource from the collection identified by a navigation property on the target object. This operation deletes the relationship between the two resource objects bound by the relationship.

MemberSignature.Value: public object ResolveResource (object resource);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object ResolveResource(object resource) cil managed
Public Function ResolveResource (resource As Object) As Object
public: System::Object ^ ResolveResource(System::Object ^ resource);
abstract member ResolveResource : obj -> obj

Docs.param: The object representing the resource whose instance needs to be retrieved.
Docs.summary: Returns the instance of the resource represented by the specified resource object.
Docs.returns: The instance of the resource represented by the specified resource object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called to resolve the opaque object returned by the <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable.CreateResource%2A> or <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable.GetResource%2A> API into the CLR instance. This is normally called after <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable.SaveChanges%2A> to serialize the resource for POST methods.
This method is also called if there are update interceptors invoked with the common language runtime (CLR) resource instances. It can be used if the provider supports optimistic concurrency and the resource type has concurrency tokens defined by <xref:System.Data.Services.ETagAttribute> in a CLR-based provider.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SaveChanges ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SaveChanges() cil managed
Public Sub SaveChanges ()
public: void SaveChanges();
abstract member SaveChanges : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Saves all the changes that have been made by using the APIs.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable> implementation must track all changes until <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable.SaveChanges%2A> is called and then save all changes when <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable.SaveChanges%2A> is called. The <xref:System.Data.Services.IUpdatable> implementation is expected to save all of the changes or to reject all of the changes together.
